channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Canada and Mexico’s Leaders Took Different Routes to a Tariff Deal With Trump
item.description: The Canadian and Mexican leaders negotiated with President Trump in diverging ways. In the end, they both secured an outcome they could present as vic...

item.title: Tesla and Apple are the ‘Magnificent Seven’ firms hit hardest by tariff shocks
item.description: Tesla’s stock fell 5% on Monday, the biggest drop for any member of the so-called Magnificent Seven, while Apple shares dropped 3%.

item.title: Top Doctors Question Conviction of ‘Killer Nurse’ Lucy Letby in 7 Baby Deaths
item.description: After assessing the cases of 17 babies cited at her original trial, a panel of world-renowned specialists said that they had found no evidence that Ms...

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu Meeting Is Expected to Focus on Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: The president will welcome the Israeli prime minister to the White House for his first in-person meeting with another world leader since returning to ...

item.title: DeepSeek has tilted the balance towards open source AI, but big security issues remain
item.description: OpenAI Sam Altman says his company is "on the wrong side of history" with a business model built purely around proprietary AI models.

item.title: Trump created the first ever U.S. sovereign wealth fund: Will it include Bitcoin?
item.description: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis sparked excitement by calling the move a “₿ig deal.”

item.title: Kultida Woods, Mother of Tiger Woods, Dies at 80
item.description: In announcing her death, Mr. Woods spoke of her sacrifices and support throughout his life and career.

item.title: Los Angeles Had Substandard Hydrants Near Devastating Fire’s Starting Point
item.description: The Palisades fire first took hold in a neighborhood where many hydrants had only a single small outlet for firefighters to use.

item.title: China Strikes Back After Trump Imposes 10% Tariff on Goods
item.description: After a 10 percent tariff on Chinese products took effect on Tuesday, China announced retaliatory measures, including tariffs and an investigation of ...

item.title: How Canada and Mexico’s Leaders Took Different Routes to a Tariff Deal With Trump
item.description: The Canadian and Mexican leaders negotiated with President Trump in diverging ways. In the end, they both secured an outcome they could present as vic...

item.title: Greenland, Eyeing Trump, Bans Foreign Political Funding
item.description: The law, billed as an effort “to safeguard Greenland’s political integrity,” came ahead of parliamentary elections.

item.title: Patriots Owner’s Son Challenges Michelle Wu for Mayor of Boston
item.description: Josh Kraft, a political newcomer who is running as a Democrat, said his top priority was addressing the city’s housing crisis.

item.title: The Closed-Door Battle to Become IOC President
item.description: In perhaps the quirkiest election in sports, seven officials are vying for the powerful position of president of the International Olympic Committee.

item.title: Goldman Sachs says Trump’s tariffs could bruise stocks, estimating every 5-percentage-point increase would slash S&P 500 earnings per share by 1%–2%
item.description: Before the U-turn on tariffs, Goldman Sachs said “there is a substantial probability that the tariffs on Canada and Mexico will be temporary.”

item.title: White House confirms Elon Musk is a ‘special government employee’ who could avoid publicly disclosing finances and conflicts of interest—and will only work for 130 days a year
item.description: Musk’s last two weeks have been marked by a frenzy of activity and a claim he’s been sleeping in the DOGE office.
